title: Zanab247
author: Zanab247
content: There is no way you will think about this current economy in Nigeria you will not share tears for Nigeria. I thought I have seen it all for poor economy until I saw this new economy that is coming like what will end many people lifes in the land and, the new officials are not coming with minds of fighting some of the things that caused all those things to happened in the past government. I thought that what we saw in Jonathan economy is a worst economy to the citizens of Nigeria until I seen Buhari economy that turned to fire into the lifes of the citizens, were the price of commodities increase double, and cashless politics was like fuel pumping the hardship that made many youths to start finding their way to other countries to save their lifes, and many Â industries stopped working for Buhari regime because of the huge amount of taxes the government officials was generating from the companies that was accommodating some citizens to have something to earn monthly to fend their families, and it caused many companies to fold up and many citizens went with frustration.I thought, I have seen it all until I begin to see some things that is worst than the previous economy. I used to buy a liter of fuel #180 in Buhari regime but, since we entered this new regime the price of fuel hit #500 that made many things to went wrongs in the Nigeria economy and the worst thing is that the new government is not bring any strategies that will improve the weak economy. This is my question, How will Nigeria economy look like when this new government is approaching her second tenure? Because the way the new government economy look like now show, that we are about to enter disaster that will make other country to take over the country.What is your opinion my Naija people.

comments.author: Hewlet
comments.body: It's no doubt that the economy is gradually going from bad to worse and that most of the policies of both the present and past administration hasn't yielded much result that will alleviate the poverty-ravishing the land but that's not enough reason to conclude that the last administration hasn't made successes in some sectors of the nations economy. You have to understand that each of this administration had an agenda before even getting elected into office and while one might be focused on boosting the economy, another might centre it policy on security or infrastructural development. Nigeria is a complex society and sometimes I don't generally blame the different president for their inability to tackling certain national issues because they all have ministers and personnel that are saddled with the different responsibility of ensuring that the different sectors function effectively, it's just unfortunate that most of them are not always able to effectively carry out this responsibility.And I think I disagree with you regarding your statement that this administration has failed so far. The administration is still new and so far I have seen some reasonable policies that they've embarked on that will be of help to the average Nigerian. I'm not politically attached to any of these politician but I feel say e de necessary make we no too de condemn them everytime.

Naija's economy don bad reach where nothing dey common again to afford for this Naija.
